Title: Risk Manager, Vendor Investigations & Transaction Accuracy, Vendor Investigations & Transaction Accuracy
Description: Job Description :Job summaryVITA (Vendor Investigations and Transaction Accuracy) mission is to identify and prevent erroneous and fraudulent payments to vendors and carriers globally. VITA uses advanced detection and prototyping methods for identifying anomalies in invoicing, payment, and other financial data. Investigators carry out complex investigations to ultimately prevent bad actors from receiving funds fraudulently. VITA is fundamental to ensuring Amazon's Global Accounts Payable is able to deliver on its mission to pay vendors correctly and on time.If you are excited about finding bad actors, building fraud analytics, developing forensic analysis products, risk management, strategic thinking and analytical skills, then this new and rare opportunity is for you!We are seeking a senior investigator ensuring Amazon's Finance Operations processes stay ahead of erroneous and fraudulent payment risks in the Digital business. This investigator will look for suspicious transactions in vendor invoicing, vendor payments, and vendor account creation with the goal of stopping fraud before it occurs. They will be required to review large datasets within a defined timeline to provide stakeholders with information about vendors. The candidate must be eager to drive improvements and innovation in detecting possible fraud scenarios by conducting a detailed analysis of large quantities of data. They should have the ability to take ownership and communicate effectively with technical teams to achieve the process objectives. Our ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced and ambiguous environment, has outstanding data analysis and auditing skills, is passionate about inventing new ways to detect fraud, thinks globally, and has the ability to think big to contribute innovative ideas. This is a high visibility opportunity to partner with Amazon business, and technology teams to make important improvements throughout our business.Key job responsibilities. Understand and follow Amazon's policies and procedures on invoice entry, transaction processing, account creation in Digital. Carry out the vision and mission of the VITA team to prevent, detect, and investigate issues of potential fraud scenarios using transactional data.. Identify and clearly define issues and root causes for the potential fraud and provide recommendations on controls to mitigate the risk.. Identify new and emerging patterns of fraud and compromise and proactively take ad hoc actions to improve efficiency and reduce time to identify new fraud techniques, tactics and procedures.. Execute audits, deep dives, and special projects in a timely manner while communicating recommendations and findings to management and other stakeholders.. Collaborate with tech teams to create and test new analytics: exam new data sets to identify trends and suspicious behaviors. Propose process improvement ideas and work with other teams to implement solutions to increase controllership.. Maintain productivity targets and timelines.. Coordinate tasks within team members, including other Finance Operations teams, on any activities assigned to the team as a whole.Basic Qualifications :. Bachelor's Degree in Risk Management, Business, Statistics, Computer Science, or any other quantitative field from an accredited institution.. 3-5 years of relevant professional experience in Risk Management, Fraud Investigations Analytics, Business Intelligence, or a Data Science.. Candidate should have good English skills, including excellent business writing.. Proficiency with Microsoft Office products, including intermediate to advanced Excel.. Must be passionate about data analytics and have a natural curiosity and ability to dive deep into large datasets uncovering insights and presenting relevant findings to business partners.. Experience with SQL and using visualization tools such as Tableau or QuickSite.Preferred Qualifications :. Candidate should have good attention to details. Interest in accomplishing goals and exceeding expectations.. Excellent organizational and prioritization skills with the ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously.. Experience working in a high paced environment with a high degree of ambiguity.. Strong controllership focus.. Master's degree in related field (Risk Management, Business, Statistics, Computer Science).. Experience in complex business analysis and research, including experience in operations and financial reviews.. Experience in Digital Fraud investigations.

Title: Sr Technical Program Manager, MARS
Description: Job Description :Job summaryAmazon is investing heavily in building a world class advertising business and we are responsible for defining and delivering a collection of self-service performance advertising products that drive discovery and sales. Our products are strategically important to our Retail and Marketplace businesses driving long term growth. We deliver billions of ad impressions and millions of clicks daily and are breaking fresh ground to create world-class products. We are highly motivated, collaborative and fun-loving with an entrepreneurial spirit and bias for action. With a broad mandate to experiment and innovate, we are growing at an unprecedented rate with a seemingly endless range of new opportunities.As a Sr Technical Program Manager (TPM) you would be required to monitor the overall project progress, anticipate risks, resolve issues and initiate corrective action as appropriate. The successful candidate will have experience in managing complex projects, and have the ability to influence cross functional stakeholders to implement initiatives supporting the objectives.The candidate should demonstrate high attention to detail, including proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities. Ability to deal with ambiguous situations and collaborate with the stakeholders to deliver results will be crucial for success in this role. This role requires an individual with expertise in program management, along with excellent analytical and communication abilities. The successful candidate will be a self-starter, with strong attention to detail, vocally self-critical, with an ability to work in a fast-paced environment.Basic Qualifications :Bachelor's degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science or a related technical field12+ years experience with complex technology projects involving data analysis, software engineering and program management.Prior experience with agile methodologies.Experience with project delivery for large, cross functional projects.Experience developing Internet products and technologies.Experience managing projects across cross functional teams, building sustainable processes and coordinating release schedules.Proven analytical and quantitative skills, and tools to perform analysis. Ability to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions and develop project business cases.High attention to detail including precise and effective customer communications.Ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously.Ability to understand and discuss technical concepts, schedule tradeoffs and opportunistic new ideas with technical employees.Should be able to think strategically and execute methodically and tactically.Superior verbal and written communications skills. - Ability to work in a fast-paced environment where continuous innovation is desired.History of teamwork and willingness to roll up ones sleeves to get the job done.Preferred Qualifications :Experience with managing technical solutions for Ads domain.Prior experience in working with ML/Data Science teams.Experience building and launching consumer software products for web, mobile or desktop platforms.A deep understanding of the SDLC and consistent record of achieving program objectives on schedule, on budget and meeting quality criteria

Title: Head of Business Ops
Description: Job Description :Job summaryAre you interested in shaping the future of movies and television Do you want to define the next generation of how and what Amazon customers are watching Prime Video is a premium streaming service that offers customers a vast collection of TV shows and movies - all with the ease of finding what they love to watch in one place. We need your passion, innovative ideas, and creativity to help take the service to new heights.Amazon Studios is the movies and television development and production arm for Prime Video. It is our role to develop and produce original content for our global Prime Video customers. We need your passion, innovative ideas, and creativity to help take us to new heights.We are seeking a Head of Studios Business Operations to scale our business operating model (people, processes, technology, business insights) across India, driving the organization towards increase success on our content KPIs (e.g., quality, scope, timelines, costs, performance) and leveraging them as the Studio grows globally. Working closely with the Studios Head of Original Content in India, this role will be instrumental in the continuous development and improvement of our business practices, processes, and tools that define how we work in making tv series and movies content. The role will engage in strategic thinking and operational excellence to manage and deliver high-impact projects across the organization. The Head of Business Operations will work with key stakeholders across Prime Video and Studios to implement global best practices and tools, drive consistency of operational mechanisms, analyze performance metrics, identify and gather business requirements for continuous improvement, document project progress, assemble the appropriate stakeholders and project teams, develop and manage milestones to ensure timely and successful delivery of projects. This role assesses and manages risk, measures and reports on progress, anticipates and resolves bottlenecks, provides escalation management, anticipates and makes trade-offs. It relies heavily on influence over authority to drive adoption of change.Key job responsibilities. Establish and improve business and decision-making processes that impact the organization across the lifecycle of a series or movie, from development to greenlight to production to release.. Drive ways to keep overhead low, leveraging technology, and ensure that human capital is applied towards high value functions and output.. Work cross-functionally with senior and regional leadership across creative development, strategy, business affairs, legal, production, music, finance, accounting, data science, programming, consumer insights, and casting to identify new initiatives and drive them through to execution.. Perform complex analysis and create business driving documents that surface key learnings and recommend new content business initiatives.. Manage weekly, monthly, and quarterly operational project reporting to track progress, manage escalations, and continuously drive the organization towards our goals.. Prioritize well and communicate clearly across all levels of the organization with a proven ability to influence others to adopt change.. Collaborate with operations leads across other regions to identify and execute on global operational improvements.Basic Qualifications :Basic Qualifications. 8+ years in the entertainment industry coupled with a Master's in Business Administration (or equivalent senior leadership experience). Experience in strategy, business operations, program management, or business development in the media or entertainment industry.. A passion to innovate and simplify, fostering a culture of positive improvement.. Not required, but added bonus if fluent in multiple dialects.Preferred Qualifications :. Experience managing, analyzing, and communicating results to senior management.. Demonstrate ability to implement processes, change management, and applying standardization across an organization.. A passion for content, digital media, and digital video.. Strong writer.

Title: Technical Program Manager II
Description: DESCRIPTIONThe HIL Data Operations TeamHuman in Loop service (Sagemaker Ground Truth and A2I) leverages machine and humans to enable customers to create good quality training data which are used to train machine learning models. The quality of model and the inferences in production is driven by the accuracy and quality of the human annotations across all modalities  Text, documents, 2D images, Video and 3D point cloud across mapping, autonomous vehicle, computer vision and NLP domains. We're looking for an analytical and customer-obsessed Program Manager who has experience with building and working on large scale labelling and data annotation operations. This will require them to understand customer requirements , define policies and quality systems, and develop training programs to deliver best in class annotations. They will work closely with product & engineering to ensure product is tested at every stage of development for efficiency and quality. This role will tap into their ability to wear multiple hats - responsibility for delivery of programs with customers, working with product/UX/engineering to drive tool improvements, work on process improvement to improve quality/efficiency/policy dissemination.What you'll do:Own and deliver labelling and annotation programs in the Computer Vision and NLP domains.Ideate and drive programs aimed at driving efficiencies for The HIL Data Operations Team vendor workforce through various functional capabilities spread across operations management, process improvement, policy, quality, automation and analytics.Build and drive strategy/roadmap for your capability area (labelling policy , quality systems, automation , process excellence)Collaborate with key stakeholders for scoping and prioritizing project activities based on the business impact and team OKRsTurn analysed data into actionable deliverables for the product, support, and operational improvementsInterface with tech leads and engineers to estimate efforts, define milestones, track progress, resolve dependencies, evaluate risks and communicate status to project stakeholdersAbility to work with engineer/product/internal teams to deliver tool/tech solutions that will drive long term improvements in operational efficiency.Communicate plans, insights, data, and results to project stakeholdersShare frameworks, tools, best practices that improve the delivery of projects with focus on reusability and standardizationDesign experiments and interpret the results to draw detailed and actionable conclusionsPresent findings to senior management to guide business decisionsTrack, analyze, and report data patterns and trends associated with the programs you ownWhat you'll needMinimum 4 years of experience in program management. Experience in labelling operations is preferred.Experience in solving problems, both structured and ambiguous, at scale with a strong bias towards innovation.Excellent written and verbal communication skills, ability to influence and motivate people (with both technical and non-technical individuals) across a broad variety of job functions through your relationshipsStrong analytical and quantitative skills with the ability to use data and insights to influence stakeholdersExperience with process design and optimisation, automation, designing quality control systems, and customer support strategies preferably in large scale operations.Willing to explore and learn new technologies, hybrid processesBonus points if you have:Worked on AI/ML based operations, labelling and annotation operationsData skills with working knowledge of SQLKnowledge of Python and prior experience building tools using Machine Learning models/using Python for data science and anayticsWorked at a high paced, fast-growing, scrappy tech startup.BASIC QUALIFICATIONSWhat you'll needMinimum 4 years of experience in program management. Experience in labelling operations is preferred.Experience in solving problems, both structured and ambiguous, at scale with a strong bias towards innovation.Excellent written and verbal communication skills, ability to influence and motivate people (with both technical and non-technical individuals) across a broad variety of job functions through your relationshipsStrong analytical and quantitative skills with the ability to use data and insights to influence stakeholdersExperience with process design and optimisation, automation, designing quality control systems, and customer support strategies preferably in large scale operations.Willing to explore and learn new technologies, hybrid processesPREFERRED QUALIFICATIONSMBA with a technical background, Worked in large scale operations (Especially ML/AI Labeling Operations)

Description: About Standard CharteredWe're an international bank, nimble enough to act, big enough for impact. For more than 160 years, we've worked to make a positive difference for our clients, communities, and each other. We question the status quo, love a challenge and enjoy finding new opportunities to grow and do better than before. And we can't wait to see the talents you can bring us.Our purpose, to drive commerce and prosperity through our unique diversity, together with our brand promise, to be here for good are achieved by how we each live our valued behaviours. Title: Data Scientist II
Description: Job Description :Job summaryCome and be part of the AWS Supply Chain Automation (SC.os) team and build systems that enable AWS to rapidly grow and continue to be the pioneer and widely recognized leader in Cloud Computing, and have direct and immediate impact on the hundreds of thousands developers and businesses around the world who use AWS every day.  Supply Chain Management (SCM) systems are at heart of ensuring that we can provide our customers with the right computing services, in the right region, at the right time! The SCM team is responsible for building inventory and warehouse management systems that enable control of our global footprint for our hyper-growth cloud and automate the orchestration required to ensure physical and financial control of inventory. Our team is responsible for billions of dollars in capital and the ultimate success of our core cloud infrastructure business.We are looking for an experienced Data Scientist who is a savvy with unstructured data, strong in building ML/statistical/OR/econometric models, and has strong problem solving and customer-facing skills. You will work with business leaders, scientists, product managers, and engineers to formulate scientific problems, conduct analyses and statistical inference, build scalable and flexible models/algorithms/frameworks, and help our customers apply insights and solve business problems. You will drive actions that scale across SC.os org and beyond.To know more about Amazon science, Please visit https://www.amazon.scienceKey job responsibilitiesPosition Responsibilities: . Design, develop, and simulate engineering solutions/scientific artefacts for complex resource planning and management challenges in a multi-echelon supply chain for the global data center network. . Build decision-making models and propose solution for the business problem you defined. This includes delivery of algorithms to be used in production systems.. Conduct written and verbal presentation to share insights and recommendations to audiences of varying levels of technical sophistication. . Retrieve, synthe, and present critical data in a format that is immediately useful to answering specific questions or improving systems performance. . Provide requirements to develop analytic capabilities, platforms, and pipelines. . Design and execute experiments, and analyze experimental results in collaboration with Product Managers, Business Analysts, Economists, and other specialists. . Partner with data engineering teams to improve data assets, quality, metrics and insights.. Leverage industry best practices to establish repeatable applied science practices, principles & processes.To know more about Amazon science, Please visit https://www.amazon.scienceBasic Qualifications :. Master's degree in math, economics, engineering, statistics, or related discipline is required 2+ years professional experience in machine learning, statistical modeling, data mining, and analytics techniques or, Bachelors degree or foreign equivalent in Industrial Engineering, Operations Research, Machine Learning, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field and 5+ years professional experience in data science disciplines.. Must have atleast one year of experience in some of the following skills: developing quantitative models, linear programming, optimization, process mining, graph processing, anomaly detection, recommendation systems. Experience with Python/R. Familiarity with AWS (or similar cloud) solutions such as EMR, S3, and Redshift. Experience working with large, multi-dimensional datasets from multiple sources. SQL and big data technologies. Ability to work cross-functionally, building and maintaining trust with internal stakeholdersPreferred Qualifications :. Ph.D. or Master's in Operations Research, Statistics, Applied Mathematics or related field and 2+ professional experience.. Programming / scripting experience (Java/Scala, Python, R, Ruby, C#, and/or PHP).. Experience in building algos for production systems. . Experience collaborating with finance, operations and engineering teams.. Expertise in pattern recognition/graph theory/ process modelling/ neural networks/reinforcement learning. Hands on knowledge of cloud computing and AWS services - lambda, batch, etc.. Excellent analytical and communication skills and ability to influence stakeholders.

Title: Business Analyst II, Abuse Prevention
Description: DESCRIPTIONJob summaryWithin CTPS, the Abuse prevention team launches products and services that detect and prevent abuse on our store before it impacts a customer. We work with business partners across the organization to find and close gaps that lead to abuse and create and enforce selling policies that help ensure we have a fair marketplace. Our product and program managers work hand in hand with our engineering and science partners to develop and implement innovative solutions that help Sellers become successful and stop bad actors at scale, globally.We are seeking a candidate who loves solving complex problems, is passionate about stopping bad actors and protecting customers. Plus, strong analytical skills and a proven track record of being able to successfully identify a solution, prepare a plan and execute it with strong results. Key job responsibilitiesWe are seeking an exceptional Business Analyst to drive analysis and insights to help our teams make meaningful business decisions. As a Business Analyst, you will focus on improving the success of Sellers in our store by analyzing data, discovering and solving real world problems, and building metrics and business cases to improve customer experience. We are focused on your success and want to build future leaders within Amazon. A key component of the role is to identify process and system improvement opportunities by monitoring existing metrics, analyzing data, and partnering with many internal teams. In addition, you will design and develop automated reporting solutions to enable stakeholders to manage the business and make effective decisions. Lastly, you will enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format.BASIC QUALIFICATIONSBachelor's degree in Business, Economics, Finance, Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics or related field, or equivalent experience4+ years of experience in a business analyst/data analyst/statistical analyst role4+ years of demonstrated proficiency analyzing data, creating dashboard and business reports using SQL.Proven experience writing scripts using SQL, extracting and analyzing the data to provide precise reports to stakeholders.Experience using data visualization platforms (e.g. QuickSight, Tableau, PowerBI)Demonstrated ability to consistently maintain a high level of integrity and discretion to handle confidential information.Experience conducting deep dive analyses of business problems identifying root cause of business trends, formulating insights and recommendationsStrong interpersonal skills and advanced ability to communicate complex technology solutions to senior leadership, gain alignment, and drive progressPREFERRED QUALIFICATIONSMaster's degree or higher in Statistics, Data Science, or an equivalent quantitative fieldExperience working in risk, fraud, or ML organizations.Ability to create detailed business analysis, outlining problems, opportunities and solutions for a business stakeholders.Familiar with defining configuration specifications and business analysis requirementsExperience scripting in Python or R

Title: Senior Associate - Cost Analysis
Description: With a startup spirit and 90,000+ curious and courageous minds, we have the expertise to go deep with the world&rsquos biggest brands&mdashand we have fun doing it. Now, we&rsquore calling all you rule-breakers and risk-takers who see the world differently, and are bold enough to reinvent it. Come, transform with us.Are you the one we are looking forInviting applications for the role of SA, Cost AnalysisIn this role, you will be responsible to demonstrate innovation and intuition in identifying areas requiring operational adaptation and/or improvement Active user of Internet and online applications.Responsibilities. The key requirement is to perform Contract cost Analysis. Support and execute computation of contracts cost at various key bucket levels. The analyst should help business to identify areas of cost reduction opportunities. Analyze top cost drivers and drive best practices sharing in comparison with benchmarks. Maintain high sensitivity of the cost information. Post opportunity identification initiate reviews with the respective stakeholders and leads within the team. The analyst should be able to understand the Accounts payable system and should also support critical financial activities across various contracts. Supports on various ad hoc projects and data requirements. Generate & Run various report to support new opportunities. Work with larger team to help identify NVAs in the process and help streamline them. Support with data collection from various sources defined to support in next level analytics. Support with building digital tool&rsquos for value analysis. Understanding the integrities of contracts, laying out data requirement, obtaining data, managing resources to do the relevant analysis, build a model, and deliver actionable reports.. Analyzing billings, cost, and revenue and operating margins for the contracts and eliminate noncompliant elements which might affect the KPIs.. Work with client directly on large set of data. Ensuring data gets presented in a structured way to understand the finances specific to it. Generate crisp reports on the same and provide actionable insights.. Work with internal teams to work on new analysis/ analytics services that could be provided to clients.. Understand data availability and come up with suggestions in terms of addition analysis that could be provided.. Conceptualize or help visualize solution for the focus area.. There might be requirement to run pilots or projects on various areas which is expected to be owned end to end.. Defining approach, interacting with the client, laying out data requirement, obtaining data, managing resources to do the relevant analysis, build a model, and deliver actionable reports.. Ability to use superior communication, problem-solving, and analytical skills to frame decisions for senior management and drive optimized decision-making. Excel at delivering the highest levels of client service and enjoy working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.. Able to be self-directed and work independently in order to meet and exceed goals. Work effectively in a team environment.Qualifications we seek in you!Minimum qualifications. Bachelor&rsquos Degree / MBA. Effectively communicate in English, in both written and oral forms. Experience working with diverse stakeholders in a multi-vendor environmentPreferred qualifications. Basic knowledge in Data Science. Analytical Mind, Reasoning skills, ProactiveGenpact is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, age, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, military/veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. Title: Lead Product Manager- Technical
Description: Our PurposeWe work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion (https://www.mastercard.us/en-us/vision/who-we-are/diversity-inclusion.html) for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team - one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results. Job TitleLead Product Manager- Technical OVERVIEW Are you a Product Manager with strong technical skills, or a current or former software engineer or software architect who wants to do much more You can, as Product Manager - Technical at Mastercard. You get to shape the future of Mastercard's products. At Mastercard, we build technologies that connect individuals, businesses and organizations everywhere around the world every day to the things that matter the most, creating greater opportunities for all. We also ensure that every employee has the opportunity to be a part of something bigger and has the opportunity to improve lives for everyone. Mastercard ranks among the World's Most Admired Companies, the World's Most Ethical Companies, the World's Most Innovative Companies, America's Best Employers for Diversity, HRC's Best Places to Work, OUTstanding Leading LGBT+ & Ally Executives, Top Companies for Women. ROLE As Product Manager for Digital Product Enablement, you will lead conceptualization through delivery of our next generation platform capabilities that add value to the ecosystem of cardholders, issuers and merchant partners. You will be responsible for fleshing out business concepts providing clarity of thought, decomposing requirements into user stories, prioritizing the backlog, and accepting work from the scrum teams. You are a key stakeholder in what will ultimately be built. You will have a long term perspective and look beyond the current business needs to become expert in your domain. In doing so, you will integrate the right technology solutions to build a performant scalable sustainable platform. ALL ABOUT YOU: . Obsess about delivering the best end-to-end customer experience . Own the problem space and do what it takes to design and deliver the complete product . Collaborate with peers to deliver consistent technology and experiences across our portfolio . Demonstrate sound technical and business judgment . Be able to read code (Java, C++, etc), collaborate with designers & architects, rapidly learn new technologies, and choose the right technologies and solutions . Debate the merits of options with engineers, architects, designers and business teams to drive the right trade-offs . Dive deep into the intricacies of the customers context, the technical code or architecture, and the operational characteristics of the product . Communicate to executives, peers, and staff with impact, eloquence, and authenticity . Ensure features and associated documentation are clear and easily consumable by other engineering teams . Demonstrated experience building organizational relationships, partnering with and influencing teams while commanding the respect of the individuals on the team . Product development or engineering experience . Depth of experience with Cloud, Big Data, Data Science/Analytics, Microservices are a big plus . BS/MS/MBA in related discipline COVID-19 ConsiderationsIn many locations, we've implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by video or phone. In addition, in our NYC offices, as required by law, only individuals who have been fully vaccinated against COVID-19 will be permitted inside Mastercard offices unless a reasonable accommodation has been approved in advance. Corporate Security ResponsibilityAll activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must: Abide by Mastercard's security policies and practicesEnsure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessedReport any suspected information security violation or breach, andComplete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard's guidelines.
